block.p: Pittsburgh 29, Rutgers 17
Torrie Cox returned a kickoff 86 yards for a touchdown as Pittsburgh overcame seven turnovers and two missed field-goal attempts to beat visiting Rutgers, 29-17, yesterday.
Pitt (4-0, 1-0 Big East) is off to its best start since 1991, when it opened 5-0.
Pittsburgh 29, Rutgers 17
Torrie Cox returned a kickoff 86 yards for a touchdown as Pittsburgh overcame seven turnovers and two missed field-goal attempts to beat visiting Rutgers, 29-17, yesterday.
Pitt (4-0, 1-0 Big East) is off to its best start since 1991, when it opened 5-0.
Rutgers (2-2, 0-2) lost quarterback Mike McMahon to a strained right shoulder in the second quarter. McMahon was injured when he was sacked by linebacker Lewis Moore.
Boston College 48, Navy 7
Tim Hasselbeck passed for a career-high 355 yards, including two touchdowns to Dedrick Dewalt, for host Boston College (2-1).
Hasselbeck, who finished 20 of 28, had the most yards passing by a Boston College quarterback since Scott Mutryn threw for 369 yards in a 32-31 loss to Navy on Oct. 24, 1998.
East Carolina 34 Syracuse 17
At Greenville, N.C., David Garrard threw three long touchdown passes and East Carolina's defense made three fourth-down stops in the second half as the Pirates (3-1) beat Syracuse (1-2).
Bucknell 12, Columbia 10
In Lewisburg, Pa., Lucas Phillips found Jim Horan in the end zone with under a minute to go to lift Bucknell (2-1).
Columbia fell to 1-1.
Penn 45, Lafayette 28
Gavin Hoffman passed for 301 yards and 3 touchdowns and the reserve tailback Mike Verille scored three times for host Penn (1-1).
Harvard 42, Brown 37
In Providence, R.I., Neil Rose passed for 412 yards and 3 touchdowns for the Crimson.
New Hampshire 42 Dartmouth 21
Ryan Day passed for four touchdowns and Stephan Lewis scored three times as host New Hampshire (4-0) routed Dartmouth in the renewal of their cross-state rivalry.
Cornell 24, Yale 23
Rick Rahne threw a 15-yard touchdown pass to Joe Splendorio with 2:16 remaining to give host Cornell the comeback victory.
Peter Iverson followed Rahne's pass with his third extra point of the day to lift Cornell (1-1, 1-0) in the Ivy League opener for both teams.
Colgate 21, Fordham 6
Tom McCune passed for 313 yards and 2 touchdowns and ran for one score to lead host Colgate.
Temple 49 Eastern Michigan 40
In Philadelphia, Tanardo Sharps rushed for a career-high 203 yards and 2 long touchdowns and Devin Scott threw 3 scoring passes to lead Temple (3-1).
Hofstra 30 Rhode Island 12
In Hempstead, N.Y., Rocky Butler threw two touchdown passes as Hofstra (3-1) beat Rhode Island (0-3).
Hofstra trailed, 12-0, before scoring 30 straight points.
Lehigh 20, Princeton 18
In Princeton, N.J., Brant Hall threw two touchdown passes and Sam Perryman and Jason Pinkney combined to break up a late 2-point conversion attempt to lead Lehigh (3-0) over Princeton (0-2).
